data.title: The current issue of JAMA Network Open
data.meta_description: Read the current issue. Keep up to date with the latest research and invited commentaries.
data.text:
CORRECTION

Error in Abstract

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2435956. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.35956

PEDIATRICS

Growth Restriction in the Offspring of Mothers With Polycystic Ovary Syndrome

Maren Sophie Aaserud Talmo, MD; Ingvild Skogedal Fløysand, MD; Guro Ørndal Nilsen, MD; et al.

This cohort study assesses the association of maternal polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) status with newborn anthropometrics and what modifying effect maternal body mass index, PCOS phenotype, or gestational diabetes may have.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2430543. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.30543

NEPHROLOGY

Electronic Alert Systems for Patients With Acute Kidney Injury: A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis

Jia-Jin Chen, MD; Tao-Han Lee, MD; Ming-Jen Chan, MD; et al.

This meta-analysis assesses the association between electronic alerts and patient survival, kidney outcomes, clinical practice patterns, and associated outcomes such as medical costs and hospital length of stay in patients with acute kidney injury.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2430401. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.30401

ONCOLOGY

Androgen Receptor Inhibitors in Patients With Nonmetastatic Castration-Resistant Prostate Cancer

Daniel J. George, MD; Alicia K. Morgans, MD, MPH; Niculae Constantinovici, MD, MPH; et al.

This cohort study uses electronic medical records to compare treatment and clinical outcomes for the 3 androgen receptor inhibitors (ARI) indicated for patients with nonmetastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2429783. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.29783

GERIATRICS

Racial and Ethnic Disparities in Providing Guideline-Concordant Care After Hip Fracture Surgery

Mikhail A. Bethell, MS; Kenneth A. Taylor, DPT, PhD; Colleen A. Burke, PT, DPT; et al.

This cross-sectional study investigates racial and ethnic disparities in the implementation of guideline-concordant care after hip fracture surgery among patients aged 65 years and older.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2429691. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.29691

GENETICS AND GENOMICS

Genetic Insights Into Perinatal Outcomes of Maternal Antihypertensive Therapy During Pregnancy

Ciarrah-Jane S. Barry, BSc; Venexia M. Walker, PhD; Christy Burden, MD; et al.

This mendelian randomization study uses mendelian randomization to investigate potential causal relationships between perturbing maternal genetic variants influencing antihypertensive drug targets and perinatal outcomes among offspring.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2426234. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.26234

GLOBAL HEALTH

Community-Based Participatory Research and System Dynamics Modeling for Improving Retention in Hypertension Care

Jiancheng Ye, PhD; Ikechukwu A. Orji, PhD, MPH, MBA, MBBS; Michelle A. Birkett, PhD; et al.

This decision analytical model uses system dynamics modeling to investigate whether various interventions gathered from workshops with stakeholders are associated with improved rates of retention in hypertension care in Nigeria.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2430213. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.30213

UROLOGY

5-α Reductase Inhibitors and Prostate Cancer Mortality

Robert J. Hamilton, MD, MPH; Julian Chavarriaga, MD; Najia Khurram, BSc; et al.

This cohort study examines whether prediagnostic use of 5-alpha-reductase-inhibitors is associated with mortality outcomes among individuals with prostate cancer.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2430223. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.30223

EQUITY, DIVERSITY, AND INCLUSION

Race and Ethnicity and Diagnostic Testing for Common Conditions in the Acute Care Setting

Michael I. Ellenbogen, MD; P. Logan Weygandt, MD, MPH; David E. Newman-Toker, MD, PhD; et al.

This cross-sectional study investigates the association of race and ethnicity with rates of diagnostic testing among patients in acute care.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2430306. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.30306

HEALTH POLICY

Premarket Pivotal Trial End Points and Postmarketing Requirements for FDA Breakthrough Therapies

Maryam Mooghali, MD, MSc; Joshua D. Wallach, PhD, MS; Joseph S. Ross, MD, MHS; et al.

This cross-sectional study evaluates premarket end points in pivotal clinical trials supporting FDA breakthrough therapy–designated approvals for original indications and postmarketing requirements for approvals based on confirmatory trials using surrogate markers as primary end points.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2430486. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.30486

RESEARCH LETTER STATISTICS AND RESEARCH METHODS

Trends in Maternal Death Post-Dobbs v Jackson Women’s Health

Amanda Jean Stevenson, PhD; Leslie Root, PhD

This cross-sectional study examines monthly maternal deaths after the Dobbs v Jackson Women’s Health decision.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2430035. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.30035

CORRECTION

Errors in Figure Labels

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2435266. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.35266

PSYCHIATRY

Lay-Led Intervention for War and Refugee Trauma: A Randomized Clinical Trial

Lori A. Zoellner, PhD; Jacob A. Bentley, PhD; Kawther Musa, MA; et al.

This randomized clinical trial evaluates the use of small-group intervention led by lay persons for psychological trauma experienced by Islamic refugees, maintaining religious and cultural standards.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2429661. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.29661

ONCOLOGY

Long-Term Outcomes of Adjuvant Trastuzumab for 9 Weeks or 1 Year for ERBB2-Positive Breast Cancer: A Secondary Analysis of the SOLD Randomized Clinical Trial

Heikki Joensuu, MD; Judith Fraser, MD; Hans Wildiers, MD; et al.

This secondary analysis of a randomized clinical trial compares 8-year survival outcomes of 9-week vs 1-year trastuzumab administered concomitantly with chemotherapy among patients with ERBB2-positive breast cancer.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2429772. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.29772

ONCOLOGY

Patient- vs Physician-Initiated Response to Symptom Monitoring and Health-Related Quality of Life: The SYMPRO-Lung Cluster Randomized Trial

Nicole E. Billingy, MSc; Corina J. G. van den Hurk, PhD; Vashti N. M. F. Tromp, MSc; et al.

This cluster randomized trial examines the effect of patient-reported symptom monitoring on health-related quality of life (HRQOL) in patients with lung cancer.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2428975. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.28975

PUBLIC HEALTH

Epidemiologic Analysis of a Postelimination Measles Outbreak in Central Ohio, 2022-2023

Rosemary A. Martoma, MD, MBChB; Matthew Washam, MD, MPH; Hinda Omar; et al.

This cross-sectional study identifies the demographic characteristics and transmission dynamics of a recent large measles outbreak in central Ohio to aid in maintaining measles elimination in the US.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2429696. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.29696

GASTROENTEROLOGY AND HEPATOLOGY

Hepatitis C Virus Reinfection Among People Who Inject Drugs: Long-Term Follow-Up of the HERO Study

Alain H. Litwin, MD, MPH; Judith I. Tsui, MD, MPH; Moonseong Heo, PhD; et al.

This cohort study assesses rates of hepatitis C virus reinfection among people who inject drugs and the factors associated with increased risk of reinfection.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2430024. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.30024

ONCOLOGY

Pregnancy-Related Factors and Breast Cancer Risk for Women Across a Range of Familial Risk

Jasmine A. McDonald, PhD; Yuyan Liao, MS; Julia A. Knight, PhD, MSc; et al.

This cohort study evaluates the association between pregnancy-related factors and breast cancer risk, including modification by estimated absolute risk score.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2427441. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.27441

NEUROLOGY

Repetitive Head Impacts and Perivascular Space Volume in Former American Football Players

Leonard B. Jung, MD; Tim L. T. Wiegand; Fatima Tuz-Zahra, MS; et al.

This cross-sectional study assesses the association between perivascular space volume and lifetime exposure to repetitive head impacts among American football players at risk for neurodegeneration compared with unexposed controls.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2428687. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.28687

SURGERY

Outcomes Following Surgical and Nonsurgical Treatment for Uncomplicated Appendicitis in Older Adults

Matthew Ashbrook, MD, MPH; Maggie McGing, MD; Vincent Cheng, MD; et al.

This cohort study examines the outcomes associated with surgical and nonsurgical treatment strategies for uncomplicated appendicitis in older adults with frailty.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2429820. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.29820

PUBLIC HEALTH

Extreme Weather Injuries and Fatalities, 2006 to 2021

Caroline Q. Stephens, MD, MPH; Christopher Newton, MD; Brandon Kappy, MD, MPP; et al.

This cross-sectional study examines the frequency and regional distribution of major disaster events in the US.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2429826. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.29826

PEDIATRICS

Longitudinal Changes in Youth Mental Health From Before to During the COVID-19 Pandemic

Courtney K. Blackwell, PhD; Guojing Wu, MS; Aruna Chandran, MD, MPH; et al.

This cohort study investigates changes in youth mental health status, overall and between subgroups, from before to during the COVID-19 pandemic using data from the Environmental influences on Child Health Outcomes Program.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2430198. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.30198

HEALTH POLICY

Health Insurance Enrollment Among US Veterans, 2010-2021

Todd H. Wagner, PhD; Anna Schmidt, MS; Forest Belli, BA; et al.

This cross-sectional study analyzed data from 4 surveys to characterize how insurance coverage and enrollment in Department of Veterans Affairs health insurance changed among veterans from 2010 to 2021.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2430205. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.30205

PHARMACY AND CLINICAL PHARMACOLOGY

Injurious Fall Risk Differences Among Older Adults With First-Line Depression Treatments

Grace Hsin-Min Wang, PharmD, MS; Edward Chia-Cheng Lai, PhD; Amie J. Goodin, PhD; et al.

This cohort study assesses the association between the risk of fall-related injuries and first-line treatments for depression among older US adults with depression.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2435535. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.35535

MEDICAL EDUCATION

Shared Decision-Making in Colorectal Cancer Screening for Older Adults: A Secondary Analysis of a Cluster Randomized Clinical Trial

Karen R. Sepucha, PhD; Yuchiao Chang, PhD; K.D. Valentine, PhD; et al.

This secondary analysis of a cluster randomized clinical trial evaluates the effect of physician training in shared decision-making on receipt of the patient-preferred approach to colorectal cancer screening among older adults.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2429645. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.29645

ORTHOPEDICS

Tourniquet Use and Local Tissue Concentrations of Cefazolin During Total Knee Arthroplasty: A Randomized Clinical Trial

Julien Montreuil, MD, MSc; Michael Tanzer, MDCM; Yu Ling Zhang, PhD; et al.

This randomized clinical trial of patients undergoing total knee arthroplasty examines the effect of tourniquet application during the procedure on local tissue concentrations of cefazolin.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2429702. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.29702

EQUITY, DIVERSITY, AND INCLUSION

Neighborhood-Level Disparities in Hypertension Prevalence and Treatment Among Middle-Aged Adults

Madeleine M. Blazel, BS; Adam T. Perzynski, PhD; Paul R. Gunsalus, MS; et al.

This cross-sectional study evaluates whether spatial patterns of hypertension among adults in midlife are associated with neighborhood disadvantage and racial and ethnic composition.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2429764. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.29764

RESEARCH LETTER PUBLIC HEALTH

Pharmacy Accessibility and Social Vulnerability

Giovanni Catalano, MD; Muhammad Muntazir Mehdi Khan, MBBS; Odysseas P. Chatzipanagiotou, MD; et al.

This cross-sectional study examines the association of availability of primary care practitioners and level of socioeconomic vulnerability with risk of pharmacy deserts in regions of the US.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2429755. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.29755

RESEARCH LETTER EQUITY, DIVERSITY, AND INCLUSION

Using AI and Social Media to Understand Health Disparities for Transgender Cancer Care

Augustine Annan, PhD; Yeran Li, PhD; Jingcheng Du, PhD; et al.

This qualitative study used an artificial intelligence (AI) large language model and social media to investigate challenges encountered by transgender individuals during breast and gynecological cancer care.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2429792. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.29792

CORRECTION

Errors in Figure, Text, and Table

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2434909. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.34909

ONCOLOGY

Trends in Active Surveillance for Men With Intermediate-Risk Prostate Cancer

Marshall A. Diven, MD; Lhaden Tshering, BS; Xiaoyue Ma, MS; et al.

This cohort study examines trends in the demographic and clinical characteristics of US men newly diagnosed with intermediate-risk prostate cancer whose treatment utilized active surveillance.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2429760. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.29760

HEALTH POLICY

Antitrans Policy Environment and Depression and Anxiety Symptoms in Transgender and Nonbinary Adults

Arjee Restar, PhD, MPH; Eric K. Layland, PhD; Landon Hughes, PhD; et al.

This cross-sectional study examines whether awareness of and concerns about legislation restricting health care access for transgender and nonbinary people is associated with symptoms of depression and anxiety symptoms in transgender adults.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2431306. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.31306

PUBLIC HEALTH

Disparities in Exposure to Tobacco on Television or Streaming Platforms

Henry K. Onyeaka, MD, MPH; Onyema G. Chido-Amajuoyi, MD, MPH; Itunu Sokale, MD, DrPH; et al.

This cross-sectional study examines the prevalence and factors associated with exposure to tobacco products advertised, marketed, or promoted on television or streaming platforms among US adults.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2427781. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.27781

EMERGENCY MEDICINE

Longitudinal Changes in Emergency Medical Services Advanced Airway Management

Henry E. Wang, MD, MS; Mengda Ivy Yu, MSPH; Remle P. Crowe, PhD; et al.

This cross-sectional study examines the longitudinal trends in endotracheal intubation and supraglottic airway utilization for airway management in a national emergency medical services cohort.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2427763. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.27763

HEALTH POLICY

Trends in Children’s Exposure to Food and Beverage Advertising on Television

Lisa M. Powell, PhD; Julien Leider, MA; Rebecca M. Schermbeck, MPH, MS, RD; et al.

This cross-sectional study examines changes in children’s exposure to food-related television advertising after changes in the voluntary industry self-regulatory Children’s Food and Beverage Advertising Initiative standards.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2429671. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.29671

ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH

The 2016 Severe Floods and Incidence of Hemorrhagic Fever With Renal Syndrome in the Yangtze River Basin

Haoqiang Ji, MS; Ke Li, MS; Meng Shang, BS; et al.

This cross-sectional study examines the association between severe floods and long-term incidence of hemorrhagic fever with renal syndrome in the Yangtze River basin and explores the modifying role of geographical factors in this association.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2429682. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.29682

RESEARCH LETTER UROLOGY

Thiazide Dose, Urine Calcium, and Symptomatic Kidney Stone Events

Ryan S. Hsi, MD; Phyllis L. Yan, MS; Naim M. Maalouf, MD; et al.

This cohort study examines the association between thiazide dose and urine calcium reduction and correlates urine calcium changes with the occurrence of symptomatic kidney stone events.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2428953. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.28953

CARDIOLOGY

Sex, Atrial Fibrillation, and Long-Term Mortality After Cardiac Surgery

Sergey Karamnov, MD; Natalia Sarkisian, PhD; Jakob Wollborn, MD, PhD; et al.

This cohort study evaluates whether the rates and outcomes of postoperative atrial fibrillation among patients undergoing open heart surgery differ by sex.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2426865. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.26865

PUBLIC HEALTH

Household Firearm Ownership and Firearm Mortality

Andrew R. Morral, PhD; Denis Agniel, PhD; Rosanna Smart, PhD; et al.

This cohort study evaluates the population-level temporal sequencing of firearm death rates and household firearm ownership rates among US adults from 1990 to 2018.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2429335. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.29335

PEDIATRICS

Maternal Characteristics and Prevalence of Infants Born Small for Gestational Age

Liangcheng Xiang, PhD; Xiaohong Li, PhD; Yi Mu, PhD; et al.

This cross-sectional study of more than 12.5 million singleton live births analyzes the prevalence of infants born small for gestational age in China from 2012 through 2020 and examines the association of maternal sociodemographic characteristics and other factors with that prevalence.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2429434. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.29434

ONCOLOGY

Hospital Accreditation Status and Treatment Differences Among Black Patients With Colon Cancer

Kelley Chan, MD; Bryan E. Palis, MA; Joseph H. Cotler, PhD; et al.

This cohort study uses the National Program of Cancer Registries database to evaluate the association between Commission on Cancer accreditation status of hospitals and receipt of guideline-concordant care and risk of mortality among non-Hispanic Black patients with colon cancer.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2429563. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.29563

PUBLIC HEALTH

Virtual Learning in Kindergarten Through Grade 12 During the COVID-19 Pandemic and Chronic Absenteeism

William N. Evans, PhD; Kathryn Muchnick; Olivia Rosenlund, BA

This cross-sectional study examines the association between virtual learning in kindergarten through grade 12 (K-12) education during the 2020-2021 school year and chronic absenteeism during the 2021-2022 school year at the school district level.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2429569. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.29569

SPECIAL COMMUNICATION STATISTICS AND RESEARCH METHODS

Enhancing Postmarketing Surveillance of Medical Products With Large Language Models

Michael E. Matheny, MD, MS, MPH; Jie Yang, PhD; Joshua C. Smith, PhD; et al.

This special communication examines the benefits and risks of using large language models to support medical product postmarket surveillance.

open access has active quiz

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2428276. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.28276

Errors in Simulation Model

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2433754. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.33754

EQUITY, DIVERSITY, AND INCLUSION

Continued Homelessness and Depressive Symptoms in Older Adults

Sarah K. Dobbins, PhD; Cheyenne M. Garcia, BA; Jennifer L. Evans, MS; et al.

This cohort study evaluates the association between residential status and moderate to severe depressive symptoms over a 5-year period in individuals aged 50 years or older experiencing homelessness.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2427956. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.27956

SURGERY

Antithrombin III Levels and Outcomes Among Patients With Trauma

David H. Farrell, PhD; Keeley M. McConnell, BS; Jevgenia Zilberman-Rudenko, MD, PhD; et al.

This cohort study assesses whether antithrombin III deficiency is associated with thrombohemorrhagic complications among patients with trauma.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2427786. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.27786

CARDIOLOGY

Clinical Outcomes of Mitral Valve Surgery in Atrial Functional Mitral Regurgitation in the REVEAL-AFMR Registry

Nobuyuki Kagiyama, MD, PhD; Tomohiro Kaneko, MD, PhD; Masashi Amano, MD, PhD; et al.

This retrospective cohort study investigates the prevalence, clinical characteristics, and outcomes of mitral valve surgery in atrial functional mitral regurgitation among adults in Japan.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2428032. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.28032

NEUROLOGY

Neuroimaging and Clinical Findings in Healthy Middle-Aged Adults With Mild Traumatic Brain Injury in the PREVENT Dementia Study

Audrey Low, PhD; Elizabeth McKiernan, MSc; Maria A. Prats-Sedano, PhD; et al.

This cross-sectional study of middle-aged US adults examines the association of traumatic brain injury (TBI) with neuroimaging and clinical outcomes.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2426774. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.26774

HEALTH POLICY

Perinatal and Postpartum Health Among People With Intellectual and Developmental Disabilities

Lindsay Shea, DrPH; Molly Sadowsky, MPH; Sha Tao, MPH; et al.

This cohort study examines perinatal and postpartum outcomes among a national, longitudinal sample of people with intellectual and developmental disabilities enrolled in public health insurance and compares outcomes with those of peers without intellectual and developmental disabilities.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2428067. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.28067

RESEARCH LETTER ALLERGY

Risk of Self-Reported Penicillin Allergy Despite Removal of Penicillin Allergy Label: Secondary Analysis of the PALACE Randomized Clinical Trial

Ana Maria Copaescu, MD; Sara Vogrin, MBiostat; Abby Douglas, PhD; et al.

This secondary analysis of adult patients in the Penicillin Allergy Clinical Decision Rule (PALACE) Study investigates the risk of self-reported penicillin allergy despite removal of penicillin allergy label.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2429621. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.29621

RESEARCH LETTER PEDIATRICS

Emergency Department Use by Youths Before and After Self-Inflicted Intentional Injury

Samaa Kemal, MD, MPH; Rebecca E. Cash, PhD; Jennifer A. Hoffmann, MD, MS; et al.

This cohort study describes the rate of emergency department (ED) encounters, reasons for these visits, and characteristics of the children and adolescents who seek this care.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2427350. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.27350

RESEARCH LETTER PUBLIC HEALTH

Adverse Childhood Experiences and Adult Household Firearm Ownership

Alexander Testa, PhD; Karyn Fu; Dylan B. Jackson, PhD; et al.

This survey study examines exposure to abuse, neglect, and household dysfunction during childhood and likelihood of gun ownership in adulthood.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2428027. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.28027

PUBLIC HEALTH

State COVID-19 Vaccine Mandates and Uptake Among Health Care Workers in the US

Yin Wang, MA; Charles Stoecker, PhD; Kevin Callison, PhD; et al.

This cross-sectional study explores associations between state-imposed COVID-19 vaccination mandates and vaccine uptake among health care workers in 2021.

open access has audio

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2426847. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.26847

Editorial

Vaccine Mandates for Health Care Workers—An Effective Policy Tool for Past and Future Pandemics

John B. Lynch, MD, MPH

open access

EDITORIAL

Vaccine Mandates for Health Care Workers—An Effective Policy Tool for Past and Future Pandemics

John B. Lynch, MD, MPH

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2426820. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.26820

HEALTH POLICY

Health Outcome Changes in Individuals With Type 1 Diabetes After a State-Level Insulin Copayment Cap

Theodoros V. Giannouchos, PhD, MS, MPharm; Benjamin Ukert, PhD; Thomas Buchmueller, PhD

This cohort study evaluates the association of a US state copayment cap with out-of-pocket spending, medication adherence, and health care services utilization for diabetes-related complications among individuals with type 1 diabetes.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2425280. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.25280

HEALTH POLICY

Potential US Health Care Savings Based on Clinician Views of Feasible Site-of-Care Shifts

Nikhil R. Sahni, MBA, MPA/ID; Crosbie Marine, BSc; David M. Cutler, PhD; et al.

This survey study assesses clinician views on the feasibility of site-of-care shifts from the hospital to alternative care settings and estimates potential net savings that would be associated with these shifts.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2426857. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.26857

ONCOLOGY

Long-Term Survival in Patients With Advanced Melanoma

Olivier J. van Not, MD; Alfons J. M. van den Eertwegh, MD, PhD; Hilde Jalving, MD, PhD; et al.

This cohort study evaluates long-term survival in patients with advanced melanoma treated with immune checkpoint inhibitors outside clinical trials.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2426641. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.26641

PEDIATRICS

Umbilical Cord pH Levels and Neonatal Morbidity and Mortality

Charlotte Brix Andersson, MD; Claus Klingenberg, PhD; Line Thellesen, PhD; et al.

This cohort study investigates the association between umbilical cord pH values and the risk of adverse neonatal outcomes among newborns in Denmark, which has universal umbilical cord pH measurement.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2427604. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.27604

PUBLIC HEALTH

Deer Hunting Season and Firearm Violence in US Rural Counties

Patrick Sharkey, PhD; Juan Camilo Cristancho, BA; Daniel Semenza, PhD

This cohort study investigates the association between the start of deer hunting season and the number of shootings in rural counties in the US.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2427683. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.27683

PSYCHIATRY

Depressive Symptoms in Adolescence and Young Adulthood

Katherine M. Keyes, PhD; Noah T. Kreski, MPH; Megan E. Patrick, PhD

This cohort study examines the persistence of depressive symptoms and other mental health issues from age 18 years to age 21 to 22 years.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2427748. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.27748

ONCOLOGY

Patient-Reported Outcome Measures in Cancer Care: An Updated Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis

Amaris K. Balitsky, MD, MSc; Daniel Rayner, BHSc; Joanne Britto, MD; et al.

This systematic review and meta-analysis is an update to a previous review of randomized clinical trials examining the association of patient-reported outcome measures used in cancer treatment with overall mortality risk, health-related quality of life, and hospital utilization.

open access

JAMA Netw Open. 2024;7(8):e2424793. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2024.24793

HEALTH INFORMATICS

Use of Generative AI to Identify Helmet Status Among Patients With Micromobility-Related Injuries From Unstructured Clinical Notes

Kathryn G. Burford, PhD; Nicole G. Itzkowitz, MSc; Ashley G. Ortega, BSc; et al.
